item.title: Cardboard rubbish dumped by side of house, 11th June
item.description:
It’s the day bins are collected I’ve done out this morning and there is large cardboard waste that does not belong to I or my neighbour dumped on the side of the property
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Braemar Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: It’s official, the UK is now a third world country, 11th June
item.description:
The neighbourhood is littered with household rubbish. Dirty nappies, beer bottles, etc everywhere. All over the place. I’m disgusted. In the developed world, people do recycling, here in the third world, people just dumps all their households rubbish in the street and wait for the wind to blow them away.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Furzefield Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drug users gather in the morning leaving a mess, 11th June
item.description:
Needles, broken glasses and sharp stones left under Hill Street Bridge bridge on the Surrey Canal path. Represents a serious risk for cyclicts, children, baby prams and wheelchair disabled users. Punctured my tyres there a few times as a result. Looks like homeless people from nearby shelter gather in the morning for some drug/alcohol use.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surrey Canal Walk, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, leaking water pipe, 11th June
item.description:
There is a pothole in the road, near 100 Minard Road speed bump. It's been there for ages, I think it is a leaking water pipe, it's always wet and there is always a poodle
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Minard Road, Catford South, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned overflowing bin, 11th June
item.description:
This bin has been outside my allotment for months and months. It stinks. It's overflowing with wrappers, rubbish and dog mess. It smells awful and mess keeps overflowing. The mess is being taken by foxes onto my allotment plot. Can it please be removed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellmeadow Road, Catford South, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New trees in Burnt Ash car park struggling to thrive, 11th June
item.description:
The 3 trees in the car park at Kevin Fenton Mews have dead leaves on branches, have not been watered and the water bags are torn in several places. One tree is no longer secured to the posts. Please could these be attended to. Thank you. Cllr Alisa Igoe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brindley Way, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
